prompt: Which of the following information sources would be most useful if you wanted to find a specific Federal tax form?
feedback: If you’re looking for a specific Federal tax form, the best source is the website that has Federal tax forms: the IRS website. Your state tax department’s website will have state tax forms, but it probably won’t have Federal forms. A tax accounting firm will probably have information about their firm on their website. They’re less likely to have up-to-date tax forms. The same is true about a tax preparation software website. You might find information about the software or online tax preparation, but if you want a specific Federal tax form, the IRS website is the best source.
